text:
I activated mod_proxy and mod_proxy_http on Apache 2.0.58 (Windows XP Pro SP2).
I add the following lines at the end of httpd.conf:

  ProxyRequest = off
  ProxyPass /simpeg/ http://localhost:8088/simpeg/
  ProxyPass /r3l/ http://r3l.devel.server/

which is http://localhost:8088/simpeg/ an application running on IIS (Windows)
and http://r3l.devel.server/, an application running on Apache (Linux). I got an
error message "Page not found" when access URL http://localhost/simpeg/, BUT it
is ok when I access http://localhost/r3l/.
I searched in Google, but still no enough information to solve this problem, and
many of them report the same thing, but still no solution.
I had different/other Windows server/host (using Apache 2.0.53) and had same
settings as described previously. Both ProxyPass statements are executed
properly as expected.
Is it 2.0.58 bug or else?

Thx in advance.

regards,

commedo
creator: comm-reg@portal.ebdesk.com
nick@webthing.com
text:
This isn't a support forum.

The first thing to do is to turn up your LogLevel to Debug, and check your error
log (mod_proxy gives quite a lot of information).  If that doesn't help, ask in
a support forum.
